content:
What is the common name for the 27-carbon lipid whose synthesis is
in part regulated by HMG CoA (read as: H, M, G, koh, A) reductase and is the basic starting point
for estrogen synthesis?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is NOT true regarding ribosomes:
W) they are about 20 nanometers in diameter
X) eukaryotic ribosomes are slightly larger than prokaryotic ribosomes
Y) mitochondrial ribosomes have 40S (read as: forty S) small subunits
Z) they are found in chloroplasts
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) MITOCHONDRIAL RIBOSOMES HAVE 40S SMALL SUBUNITS

content:
Which of the following has a melting point of 185ºC and readily
dissolves in water at room temperature, but is NOT an electrolyte:
W) NaCl
X) decane
Y) methane
Z) sucrose
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Give the systematic chemical name for the following ionic
compound: Cr (SeO )
2 4 3
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following BEST describes the Balmer series:
W) a series of quantum numbers indicating certain energy levels
X) hydrogen atom spectral line emission
Y) a sequence of elements that are produced chronologically in supernovae
Z) the energy spectrum of the early universe
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) HYDROGEN ATOM SPECTRAL LINE EMISSION

content:
According to the Standard Model of Particle Physics, through what
force would the top quark decay?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: WEAK FORCE (ACCEPT: WEAK or WEAK INTERACTION)

content:
Giving your answers in terms of π and in inches squared, find the total
surface area of a closed right circular cone whose altitude is 8 inches and radius is 6 inches:
subject: MATH
answer: 96π(Solution: l2 = 82 + 62, l = 10 in; LSA = πrl = π(6)(10) = 60π; SA = LA + B = 60π + π(6)2 = 96π in2)High School Round 13 Page 2

content:
Which of the following is the single most important factor
that generally sets a northern limit to tree growth, such as in the areas of transition between taiga and
tundra in Alaska:
W) high-winter winds
X) lack of summer warmth
Y) lack of spring moisture
Z) lack of soil nutrients
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of an El Nino:
W) when an El Nino is present, fish are less abundant off the west coast of South America
X) El Ninos typically come along every 4 to 5 years
Y) during a peak El Nino, strong high pressure will be present in the eastern Pacific with lower
pressure to the west
Z) El Nino affects global weather patterns
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Y) DURING A PEAK EL NINO, STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE PRESENTIN THE EASTERN PACIFIC WITH LOWER PRESSURE TO THE WEST(Solution: during peak strong high pressure is in the western Pacific with lower pressure to the east,setting up an easterly wind flow)

content: Pitchblende is one of the main ores of what element?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Order the following 3 temperature values from the
COOLEST to the WARMEST: 32ºC; 85ºF; 310 K
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
The BEST explanation of why population I (read as: one) stars
have a higher proportion of elements heavier than helium than population II ( read as: two) stars, is
because Population I stars are:
W) younger than population II stars
X) older than population II stars
Y) usually closer to planetary nebula than population II stars
Z) often found near H-I (read as: H, one) regions
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: W) YOUNGER THAN POPULATION II STARS

content: How many sidereal minutes are in 7.5 sidereal hours?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of globular proteins in
mammals:
W) most are soluble in water
X) some serve as transport molecules in the plasma
Y) plasma enzymes typically have an optimal operating pH of about 6.8 to 7.0
Z) most protein hormones are globular
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) PLASMA ENZYMES TYPICALLY HAVE AN OPTIMAL OPERATING PH OFABOUT 6.8 TO 7.0

content:
During photorespiration, the plant enzyme RuBisCO (read as: rue-
BIS-ko) will bind what molecular substance rather than carbon dioxide?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is a substance whose molecular and
empirical formulas are NOT the same:
W) benzene
X) water
Y) ammonia
Z) sulfur dioxide
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following is a molecule with a square pyramidal
molecular geometry around its central atom:
W) PCl
5
X) ClF
5
Y) XeF
4
Z) SF
6
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: X) ClF5(Solution: PCl = trigonal bipyramidal; XeF = square planar; SF = octahedral)5 4 6

content:
Which of the following has the lowest refractive index at STP:
W) diamond
X) water
Y) dry air
Z) a perfect vacuum
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Rounded to the nearest hundred joules, how much work is done in
pulling a sled across a pond for 3 meters with 100 newtons of force, with a rope that makes a 45º
angle with the pond?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: 200(Solution: w = F × d × cos angle = 100N × 3 m × 0.7071 = 212.13)High School Round 13 Page 5

content:
Find the center of the circle given by the following equation:
x2 + y2 + 4x + 16y + 3 = 0
subject: MATH

content:
What are the coordinates of the vertex in the graph of the following
equation: y = 4x2 + 8x – 5
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following is a fine-grained silica-rich
sedimentary rock that is made primarily of microcrystalline quartz:
W) shale
X) potash
Y) dolostone
Z) chert
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is a foliated metamorphic rock
composed of very fine-grained mica:
W) marble
X) phyllite
Y) quartzite
Z) schist
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: X) PHYLLITE(Solution: marble = non-foliated; quartzite = non-foliated; schist = well-developed foliation)High School Round 13 Page 6

content:
The largest deposits of diatomite, or diatomaceous
earth, are typically found in which of the following regions of the U.S.:
W) western
X) eastern
Y) midwest
Z) southern
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) WESTERN(Solution: most formed in shallow lakes and marine environments)

content:
Diatomite, or diatomaceous earth, is readily available
in the U.S. and is used primarily for which of the following functions:
W) soil improvement
X) crushed stone
Y) filtering agent
Z) lubricant
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is closest to the range for the Balmer
series:
W) microwave
X) infrared through UV
Y) UV to soft x-ray
Z) visible light to UV
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Choosing from upper right, lower right, lower left, and upper
left, in what area of the Hertzsprung Russell diagram will the Sun end its life?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which of the following is most directly responsible for the colloid
osmotic pressure in humans that acts to retain fluid in the vascular system:
W) albumin
X) sodium ions
Y) calcium ions
Z) potassium ions
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of the most common form of
DNA:
W) it is a right-handed helix
X) it has 3.4 nanometers between each successive nucleotide base of the same strand
Y) the strands are considered anti-parallel
Z) each strand has a 3-prime phosphate and a 5-prime hydroxyl at opposite ends
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Z) EACH STRAND HAS A 3-PRIME PHOSPHATE AND A 5-PRIME HYDROXYLAT OPPOSITE ENDS

content:
An organic compound with the formula C H is an:
6 14
W) alkane
X) alkene
Y) alkyne
Z) arene
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following gases has the highest effusion rate
through a pinhole opening from one compartment to another and at room temperature:
W) argon
X) CO
2
Y) SO
2
Z) helium
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following did J. J. Thompson use that primarily led
him to conclude that electrons were basic particles of atoms and carried electric charge:
W) a compass and batteries
X) a solenoid
Y) cathode ray tubes
Z) electromagnets
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Consider a satellite that is a uniform sphere rotating about its axis.
What is its moment of inertia, giving your answer in scientific notation and in kilogram meters
squared, if it has a mass of 10,000 kilograms and a diameter of 200 meters?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
An object is launched straight up from the ground with an initial velocity
of 176 feet per second. What is the height of the object above the ground, in feet, 2 seconds into the
flight?
subject: MATH
answer: 288(Solution: P(t) = -16t2 + 176t; P(2) = -16(4) + 352 = 288 ft)High School Round 13 Page 9

content:
Meteorologists think of wind as circulation patterns which
are divided into 4 “scales of motion”. A land-breeze circulation is grouped into which of the
following categories:
W) mesoscale
X) microscale
Y) medium scale
Z) synoptic
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
If the air temperature is 0ºF and the wind speed is 10
miles per hour, which of the following is closest to the wind chill, in degrees Fahrenheit:
W) 10
X) 0
Y) –10
Z) –20
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following anthropogenic air pollutants is
the major contributor to reduced visibility in most regions of the U.S., excluding fires and dust:
W) elemental carbon
X) hydrogen sulfide
Y) sulfate particles
Z) lead
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
What is the most common name for the edible vegetable
oil that is derived from cultivars of rapeseed plants and is low in erucic acid?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: CANOLA OIL (ACCEPT: CANOLA)High School Round 13 Page 10

content:
Giving your answer in decimal form, what would the “Z” value
be if a distant celestial object were shifted towards longer wavelengths by 40% of the original
wavelength?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
If a planet had an orbital period of 11.2 years, what is the length
of its orbital semi-major axis, in astronomical units rounded to the nearest whole number?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Name all of the following 3 choices that are chemoautotrophs:
Nitrosomonas (read as: nitro-so-MOAN-us) Paramecium; Volvox
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
From what vitamin is the electron carrier FAD (read as: F, A, D)
derived?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: RIBOFLAVIN (ACCEPT: VITAMIN B2)High School Round 13 Page 11

content:
Name all of the following 3 concentration units that are
temperature-dependent: molal (read as: moe-LAHL); molarity; normality
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Calculate the enthalpy of vaporization, in kilojoules, of water at
25ºC and 1 atmosphere. Assume the standard enthalpy of formation of liquid water is –286
kilojoules and the standard enthalpy of formation of water gas is –242 kilojoules:
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: 44(Solution: ∆H° = Σn ∆H°(products) – Σn∆H°(reactants) = [–242 – (–286) = +44.0 kJ)reaction p f r f

content:
What was the most sensitive device Coulomb used to measure the
electric forces between pith balls?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Order the following 3 choices from the MOST penetrating through a
thin sheet of cardboard to the LEAST: beta rays; alpha rays; x-rays
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X-RAYS; BETA RAYS; ALPHA RAYSHigh School Round 13 Page 12

content:
What is the most common name for the histone octamer used in the
coiling and packing of DNA and regulation of gene expression?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 4 organelles that are bounded by a double
membrane: nucleus; mitochondrion; lysosome; chloroplast
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: NUCLEUS; MITOCHONDRION; CHLOROPLAST(ACCEPT: ALL BUT LYSOSOME)High School Round 13 Page 13
